content.en: Sparse system algorithms: Researchers have developed various algorithms to improve the performance of system identification and adaptive filtering for sparse systems. These algorithms take advantage of the sparsity property of the systems and modify the cost functions of existing algorithms to enhance their performance. By incorporating techniques such as log-sum penalty, variable step-size strategies, and non-uniform norm penalties, these algorithms aim to achieve faster convergence, lower computational complexity, and improved accuracy in identifying and filtering sparse systems.
content.da: Sparse system-algoritmer: Forskere har udviklet forskellige algoritmer til at forbedre ydeevnen af systemidentifikation og adaptiv filtrering for sparsomme systemer. Disse algoritmer udnytter systemernes sparsitetsegenskab og ændrer eksisterende algoritmers omkostningsfunktioner for at forbedre deres ydeevne. Ved at inkorporere teknikker såsom log-sum straf, variable skridtlængdestrategier og ikke-uniforme normenstraffe, sigter disse algoritmer mod at opnå hurtigere konvergens, lavere beregningskompleksitet og forbedret nøjagtighed i identificering og filtrering af sparsomme systemer.
